com.example.projectcurie

Class CommentFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.projectcurie.CommentFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CommentFetcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Monitors a collection of questions/answers stored in the FireStore database for updates in their underlying data. If such a change is detected, fetches the latest data and executes a Runnable upon completion. This class is useful for triggering effects when a change in a collection of comments or questions is detected.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommentFetcher(java.util.ArrayList<Comment> comments)
      Associate this class with an ArrayList whose contents will be initially populated by the underlying data stored in the FireStore database, then asynchronously updated to reflect the most recent data whenever a change is detected.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fetchAnswers(java.lang.String experiment, java.lang.String questionId, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Grabs the data from a collection of answers and sets an observer such that any update to the underlying data will result in re-querying the database and trigger a caller defined Runnable to execute at its conclusion.
      void fetchQuestions(java.lang.String experiment, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Grabs the data from a collection of questions and sets an observer such that any update to the underlying data will result in re-querying the database and trigger a caller defined Runnable to execute at its conclusion.
      java.util.ArrayList<Comment> getComments() 
      void setComments(java.util.ArrayList<Comment> comments) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommentFetcher

        public CommentFetcher(java.util.ArrayList<Comment> comments)
        Associate this class with an ArrayList whose contents will be initially populated by the underlying data stored in the FireStore database, then asynchronously updated to reflect the most recent data whenever a change is detected.
        Parameters:
        comments - The ArrayList we want to populate with questions/answers from the database.

    • Method Detail

      • fetchQuestions

        public void fetchQuestions(java.lang.String experiment,
                           java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Grabs the data from a collection of questions and sets an observer such that any update to the underlying data will result in re-querying the database and trigger a caller defined Runnable to execute at its conclusion.
        Parameters:
        experiment - The title of the experiment to which the questions belong.
        runnable - User-defined Runnable that will execute each time a change in the database is detected.

      • fetchAnswers

        public void fetchAnswers(java.lang.String experiment,
                         java.lang.String questionId,
                         java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Grabs the data from a collection of answers and sets an observer such that any update to the underlying data will result in re-querying the database and trigger a caller defined Runnable to execute at its conclusion.
        Parameters:
        experiment - The title of the experiment to which the answers belong.
        questionId - The ID of the question to which the answers belong.
        runnable - User-defined Runnable that will execute each time a change in the database is detected.
